Title: Collective mental state
Content: Collective mental state is generally a literary or legal term mostly used in sociology and philosophy to refer to the condition of someones beingstate when around others. Gustave Le Bon proposed that mental states are passed by contagion while Sigmund Freud wrote of war fever in his work Group Psychology and the Analysis of the Ego 1922. Franz Borkenau wrote of collective madness while many writers have discussed collective depression.
